intro: Strongylodon mindanaensis, commonly known as the Mindanao starfruit, is a climbing shrub native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit, resembling a starfruit, is edible and has a sweet, tangy flavor. The plant is adapted to thrive in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded areas.
